attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: Make tractor drivers pass a HGV test due to to the weights tractors can now haul
attributes.background: Tractor tests have been very simple since the war, the machines themselves have got larger in comparison, the power and weight hauling capability has also increased, but the drivers exprience or knowledge has not. A tractor slid across a field with a near miss of children who were on adjacent land.

attributes.action: Make Makaton sign language part of the national curriculum and the EYFS
attributes.background: Makaton is a form of sign language used by many people with hearing or speech disabilities, if Makaton was taught from a young age signing would become as natural as learning your first language. If everyone could sign it would break down barriers, for people with disabilities and unite people.

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/calais-jungle-latest-refugee-children-unaccompanied-minors-camp-migrants-destroyed-relocated-moved-a7386551.html

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Make child benefit rules fairer
attributes.background: Currently couples with one partner earning over 60 thousand pounds annually are not entitled to any child benefit. If however both parents are working and they earn over 60 thousand pounds combined but with both individully earning less than that amount, they are entitled to this benefit.
attributes.additional_details: A couple may earn 55 thousand pounds each and get child benefit however if one person earns 60 thousand they do not.

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: Facilitate access and use of Automatic External Defibrillators (AED's)
attributes.background:
"In emergency medicine, the golden hour is the period following traumatic injury being sustained by a casualty, during this hour there is the highest likelihood that prompt medical treatment will prevent death."

For heart related emergency's the early use of an AED can be key for preserving life.
attributes.additional_details:
It is frustrating to know that AED technology is out there and publicly available and that many first aiders are trained in AED use.

I acknowledge and welcome this progress but it's difficult to get these two components together at the right place at the right time to make full use of the Golden Hour of patient care.

I ask parliament to vigorously consider the following:

1. Funding/grants so trained first aiders have their own AED.

2. A database of public AED's that can be added to mobile phone maps.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to see if UK citizens wish to keep all their current rights.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that a Referendum be held to see if there is public support for the adoption of new legislation, of whatever kind, by Parliament or other executive means, that will result in the loss or modification of any rights currently held by every UK citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the form of the Referendum should be two questions as follows:

YES. I agree to the adoption by Parliament of new legislation that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK Citizen.

NO. I do not agree to the adoption of new legislation by Parliament that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK citizen.

Currently, Parliament seems set on invoking legislation that will result in the loss of rights by all.

attributes.action: student loan forgiveness for teachers in shortage recruitment subjects.
attributes.background:
The UK currently has a recruitment issue / teachers leaving the profession.

Why can't the government wipe student loans of teachers that have given 3 years service or more in subject shortage areas such as Mathematics, Computer Science and Physics...
attributes.additional_details:
Currently offered is a large bursary to become a teacher, normally this sum is larger than the average first year wage of M1.This is attracting individuals to join the profession for a year and then leave.

By offering a student loan forgiveness for subject shortage areas this would give current teachers an insentive to stay in the profession.

It would also help boost the income of teachers lower down the M scale as it is one less expenditure from the already low starting teaching salary.

attributes.action: Increase the funding of the cadet forces of Britain
attributes.background: The cadets are poorly funded and that's not good so more money would be nice so we can all get susats and jetboils

attributes.action: Tougher punishment for crimes against teens/adults with autism/mental health.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of reading about teens and adults being targeted and on occasions killed because they are vulnerable and an easy target, they may have mental health issues/autism/learning difficulties but they are human and have enough in their lives to deal with without being attacked.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is 16 and has Autism, I worry every day about him being bullied, assaulted or attacked because of his disability.

I read an article recently that truly sickened/shocked and upset me that there are human beings out there that think it's ok to tie a teenager with special needs upside down from a tree and beat them to death, words truly fail me.

Punishment for this type of crime is too lenient, especially for teenagers who think it's a laugh to publicly humiliate vulnerable/disabled people.

Teens and adults with Autism, learning difficulties and mental health issues should feel safe and protected as not all of them have a 24hr carer or a guardian angel watching over them all of the time.

Please sign this petition and keep the vulnerable safe.

attributes.action: Review Police policies instantly rejecting candidates with visible tattoos
attributes.background: Current policies for recruitment within the force is to completely reject candidates, regardless the level of application, if the person has visible tattoos irrespective of their nature.They are looking to diversify by employing new recruits from different cultures but are contradicting that message
attributes.additional_details: Its worrying that people are being judged on appearance and not ability, if the tattoos are non offensive. Statistics show that in 2015 approximately one in 5 uk people have tattoos, this figure set to rise dramatically by 2025. Peoples attitudes to tattoos are changing and if the Home Office don't look at altering the current policies they are not only restricting good quality candidates but could find that police may be excluding themselves from certain communities within their jurisdiction.

attributes.action: Condemn the murderous attacks on the elected Leader of the Bakongo people.
attributes.background: The mandate of the current government expired on 19 December 2016. After 16 years Hyppolite Kanambe alias Joseph Kabila refuses to relinquish power and must be held accountable for the murder of un-armed civilians by Police and soldiers ultimately under his control.
attributes.additional_details: There is photographic evidence of the slaughter of un-armed civilians at the residence of The Honourable Muanda Nsemi  an elected government deputy. Currently his home is under siege with all amenities cut. At his residence there are the elderly, women and children who went there to pray. I have information that the situation is deteriorating and risks to human life is high. We want the International community to intervene to save the lives of the People of Congo. It is Imperative to act now.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to allow children under the age of 16 to have their body pierced
attributes.background:
I was watching a child cry out of fear and pain in a store which allows children to get there ears pierced. Yes the parents gave consent to it, but the child defiantly didn't know what was going on, watching this really upset me.

I think the law needs to be stricter on piercings in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Despite many piercing salons imposing their own age restrictions for body piercings, there is no legal age restriction for any kind of piercing in England and Wales, unlike in Scotland, where people under 16 are required to have a parent’s permission before having ears and other body parts pierced.

attributes.action: Allow the Church of England to legally perform gay marriages
attributes.background: The Government's Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill was on 17th July 2013. However, The Act does not allow the Church of England to perform same sex marriages. If the church is willing to perform them or not should not matter, the law should not prevent the church from doing them.
attributes.additional_details:
The legislation to create same - sex marriage was explicitly drafted so that no church or church minister can be compelled " by any means " to carry out same - sex wedding. The Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act contains the Government's ' quad lock ', a set of four safeguards for churches and ministers who disagree with same sex marriage. The fourth safeguard states that the Church of England cannot opt in under the terms of the 
2013 Act.

attributes.action: Make GCSEs test students' abilities rather than their memories
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are now based on testing students' abilities to remember things more than to actually answer the question. This makes sense for subjects like history, business studies and biology where the facts are the most important thing. This is not the case for all subjects.
attributes.additional_details: For subjects such as english where students are no longer allowed the texts they are supposed to analyse in the exam at all, it doesn't test students ability to put forward an argument, it tests students' abilities to remember certain things. It is also not practical for physics as learning the 18 formulas in not beneficial and may cause marks to be dropped even though students know what to do but they cannot remember what equation to use.

attributes.action: Make stolen motorcycle information freely available to the public.
attributes.background: Information pertaining to stolen powered two wheelers should be freely available. Registration numbers, VIN numbers and engine numbers of all vehicles reported stolen should be available on a free to use Government website with the aim of reducing theft by making stolen PTW's harder to sell.
attributes.additional_details: In the period Jan-15 to Mar-15, 6574 PTW's were reported as stolen (source www.met.police.uk/foi/pdfs/disclosure_2016/may_2016/2016030001373.pdf)  Many of these, especially in the London area have been used in robberies of individuals and shops.  As information on stolen PTW's is already available on pay to use sources, I would like to request that information held by Govt. agencies regarding theft status, colour changes and insurance history (e.g. write offs) be made freely available.

attributes.action: Referendum for the public to decide how the pension age should be set
attributes.background: The government has decided the pension age should be increased due to people living longer, the public have had no say in this so I would suggest a referendum to decide what a fair pensionable age would be in the U.K.

attributes.action: Stop variable speed limits on motorways
attributes.background: The cameras on motorways are just there to raise money not to stop accidents drivers spend more time watching there speed than driving and watching the road
attributes.additional_details: There are over 1000 speed camera fines issued per day bringing in millions for the country but doing nothing for road safety

attributes.action: Review the PIPs scoring system as being Dickensian & unfair in the 21st century.
attributes.background: The current review system is bias & unfair against disabled people who rely highly on access to places that abled people enjoy on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled people are made to feel like criminals during & following the reviews. They're made to apply for this benefit in a totally bias and unfair way on a claim form which asks 10 questions towards daily living but only 2 on mobility, which is the main purpose for disabled people applying for this benefit, in the first place. Maybe, if there must be 12 questions, a balance of 6 for daily living & 6 for mobility would be fairer & maybe provide a better view of a individuals needs?

attributes.action: Clearly state, at point of use, if NHS service is provided by the private sector
attributes.background:
The government is not being transparent regarding the number of NHS services being provided by the private sector. 

If a private company uses the NHS logo and provides an inadequate service, the reputation of the NHS is harmed.
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked in the NHS for 20 years. After the introduction of marketisation within the NHS, a huge amount of services have been contracted out. This trend is increasing. 
The cheapest provider is not always the best for improving services. Private companies withing to gain NHS contracts should have to provide EVIDENCE that they can deliver. They should be held to account when they fail. A halt on further NHS contracts to those companies would be a good idea.

attributes.action: Stop taxing overtime, to allow us an opportunity to better ourselves.
attributes.background: No one wants to be at work let alone staying on and working additional hours let's be fair! I appreciate the taxing system and fully respect paying into it from our basic wage , when I choose to work overtime I believe it should be mine not the tax man's as my bit paid from my basic is sufficient.

attributes.action: Right tostrike in essential services replaced by referralto adjudication service
attributes.background: For too long commuters/patients/the public have been the victims of protracted disputes between the unions of essential service providers and local/central government employers. Strikes are a primitive/inefficient way of resolving disputes and should be replaced by a binding adjudication service

attributes.action: Hold a General Election to allow the British Public their say on Brexit
attributes.background: We've heard many politicians and much of the media insist that Brexit is a mandate for this or a mandate for that, but the only mandate the Government has is simply to 'Leave.' I propose we hold a General Election to unify the nation and give the public a chance to articulate what Brexit should mean
attributes.additional_details: We're on course to a Hard Brexit and straight into the arms of the USA and President Trump. This is not what we voted for. Many were swayed by the promise from prominent Leave campaigners that we'd receive an extra £350 million a week for the NHS. Even more powerful was the idea that we could 'Take Control' and 'Make Britain Great Again.' Without an election, the British Public are robbed of the control they were promised and denied the chance to play their bit to make Britain Great, again.

attributes.action: Petition to increase the lowest acceptable broadband speed from 2Mbps to 10Mbps
attributes.background: The Government definition of 'basic broadband' is 2Mbps. At 2Mbps many internet services do not work. Internet usage must be limited to 1 person per household and it is difficult to load the government's own HMRC site - making life difficult for SMEs and the self employed.
attributes.additional_details: From experience, I know it is easy for Openreach to achieve speeds of 2Mbps through the UK's existing infrastructure (predominantly still copper wiring from the 1950s/60s). If the lowest acceptable broadband speed is not increased to 10Mbps, Openreach will focus on improving broadband in built up, high profit areas - areas that largely already have good internet access. The 5G roll out plan typifies this. If the focus is not shifted, many areas will never receive a decent internet connection.

attributes.action: Make the National Lottery a direct fund of the National Health Service
attributes.background: Lottery money paid by all Citizens to be the income of the National Health Service

attributes.action: Allow the President of the United States to visit the UK to create trade options
attributes.background: Banning Donald Trump from entering the UK would diminish the chances of creating a competitive trade deal with the EU. Put differences aside and try and boost the UK's negotiation position at this crucial time. Donald Trump will leave office one day.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will soon enter into negotiations with the U.K.  To make sure that a competitive deal is reached that can benefit both sides, there needs to be viable alternatives. The United States is the largest economy in the world. To limit trade ties would be a waste just because the President has ideological differences. One day Donald Trump will leave office and it would have been a waste to sideline the President, Donald Trump has already expressed interest in UK trade.

attributes.action: Implement a 20% tariff on all goods imported from the United States of America
attributes.background:
After a row over who would pay for a wall between the USA & Mexico, a bilateral summit between the two nations was cancelled by the Mexican president.
In response, President Trump now seeks to impose a 20% tariff on all Mexican goods.
In response the UK should impose a similar penalty on the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to ask the house to debate the imposition of a similarly punitive trade tariff as that which President Trump wishes to impose on Mexico. The whole world needs to stand up to bullies and the UK should lead by example.

The last time the world appeased a bully, 80 years ago, it didn't end well.

attributes.action: Before any vote on Article 50 the government must publish the trade consequences
attributes.background: MP's would be stupid to trigger Article 50 without first knowing the trade rules that would come into effect as a result. The referendum ballot did not permit MP's to be irresponsible. The public have a right to know what trade rules MPs will put in place if they decide to vote to trigger Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Only 37% of the electorate voted "leave". The vast majority of the electorate want conditions to improve following any parliamentary vote on Article 50. MPs must be able to assure the public that if they vote to trigger Article 50, trading relations will not be worsened and restrictions will not be placed on financial institutions that will damage our economy. Therefore before any parliamentary vote on Article 50, MPs must publish in full all the arrangements that will then come into effect.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays from 6 weeks to 2.
attributes.background: As a working parent I find it almost impossible to find affordable childcare for my children during the 6 weeks holidays. Most people only receive 21 days annual leave from work.
attributes.additional_details: With lack of affordable childcare for primary and high school aged children, it makes it almost impossible for most parents to find or afford childcare for the six week summer holiday. We need to move with the times and support people who want to work. Children are no longer required to help with summer harvest. 6 weeks is too long!

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Bigger fine instant ban for people who are caught driving while on the phone
attributes.background: I'm sure many of u like me are sick of seeing people texting or on the phone while driving, I for one think the new fines points etc is a complete joke. I see it on school runs right next to schools people texting or on their phone, enough is enough make it a instant ban and 5 grand fine

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: Save Our Children's Centre's and say no to closures
attributes.background: Lot's of jobs are being cut to save money. If this is done then Children's Centres will be effected.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help try and save our centres....This is not only for the parents but also for every child and member of the community who uses these places on a day to day basis.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Install speed cameras along the A52 from Priory island to Bramcote island.
attributes.background: To many people are tragically losing their lives along this stretch of road as people see it as a race track, I propose that speed cameras are installed to deter and hopefully lower the number of deaths that occur on this road.
attributes.additional_details: After a tragic accident on the 25th November 2016 that killed 2 people because of dangerous driving, this could have been prevented with speed cameras.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.
